content.description: This is the most striking line on the wall. An arete  juts out from the rock, festooned with huecos and pockets. Climb a steep, slabby opening move and grab good holds to get on the arete. Rests can be had at various ledges.
A technical but rewarding climb. It probably goes at harder than a 5.8+ and can be heady at times, especially when going for the anchors.
content.protection: It's bolted with anchors (chains). Be prepared to clean.
content.location: On The Solarium wall. The left most climb right next to all the shrubbery. There is a thin left leaning crack that follows for part of the beginning  section.

content.description: A relatively tiring climb if you are leaving the Weir Dam area via Mister Access and are climbing with your packs. Chain bolts at top are commonly used to rappel into the Weir Dam area as well.
content.location: Go through the large boulders to the right of Tomahawk area for a good face climb. Commonly used to exit the Weir Dam area, Mister Access is one of the most well traveled climbs at Continental Ranch.

content.description: This is now redundant. The Weir Dam area has the correct sub areas listed and routes within those. Thanks for adding that info.
